summary: This bill, the "Extending Limits of U.S. Customs Waters Act," aims to expand the customs waters of the United States from 12 nautical miles to 24 nautical miles, aligning with Presidential Proclamation 7219. It amends sections of the Tariff Act of 1930 and the Anti-Smuggling Act to reflect this change, specifically redefining "customs waters" for enforcement purposes. The amendments are scheduled to take effect the day after the bill's enactment.
